intro: Phyllanthus lhotzkyanus, commonly known as the Himalayan spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the Himalayas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its latex-rich sap is a distinguishing feature, often used in traditional medicine. The species is also notable for its ability to thrive in high-altitude regions with limited soil nutrients.
